IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To free children and families from the physical, emotional, and economic burden of clubfoot.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The mission of Hope Walks is to free children and families in low- and middle-income countries from the physical, emotional, and economic burden of clubfoot so every child affected can walk free from disability and encounter the love of Christ.
IRS990.Desc: Hope Walks provided materials and training so that thousands of children across Africa and Latin America would have access to quality compassionate clubfoot treatment and care, eliminating disability and enabling them to have the same opportunities as other children in their communities so through our work, families and communities both hear and experience who Jesus is and God's love for them.Hope Walks supports clubfoot treatment programs in over 170 partner clinics around the world.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule A, Part I, Line 2 Column A
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: Hope Walks, Inc began operations on May 1, 2019. The 2022 990 covers its fifth year in operation. Per the instructions public support is measured using a 5-year computation period that includes the current and four prior tax years (including short years). The organization had a short year in 2018. The below chart clarifies the information represented in Schedule A, Part II: Column (a) - 2 month period ending 6/30/19 Column (b) - Fiscal year ending ending 6/30/20 Column (c) - Fiscal year ending ending 6/30/21 Column (d) - Fiscal year ending ending 6/30/22 Column (e) - Fiscal year ending ending 6/30/23

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Fundraising Event expenses included in Part VIII, line 8b - 23791

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule F, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Hope Walks monitors the use of funds by evaluating key performance indicators on a monthly basis to ensure quality and outcomes including financial, clinicial, and counseling/spiritual. These are reviewed at both the regional and national levels by a Regional Program Officer and National Country Program Manager. Financial processes are managed by our in-country partner and audited by the Regional Program Officer and Regional Director, the accounting team, and ultimately by the President, Board, and independent auditors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule F, Part I, Line 3 Method used to account for expenditures on org's financial statements
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CENTRAL AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN-Accrual; SUB-SAHARAN AFRICA-Accrual

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule F, Part II, Line 1 Method used to account for expenditures on org's financial statements
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CENTRAL AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN-Accrual; SUB-SAHARAN AFRICA-Accrual

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b Review of form 990 by governing body
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990 is prepared by an independent CPA firm and reviewed in detail by the organization's President. The reviewed Form 990 is then provided to the board of directors prior to filing with the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c Conflict of interest policy
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization requires all officers and board members to annually complete and sign a conflict of interest questionnaire. The board is responsible for reviewing the signed statements and ensuring interested persons are in compliance with the conflict of interest policy. Should any potential conflicts of interest be disclosed, the board member or officer would be asked to refrain from participation in the deliberation or decision with regard to matters affected by the relationships.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a Process to establish compensation of top management official
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board of Directors and Finance Committee oversee the process of setting the compensation of the President and other officers of the organization using comparability data of the compensation of similar organizations. The Board also documents the compensation approval process.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b Process to establish compensation of other employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: See response for Form 990, Part VI, line 15a.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19 Required documents available to the public
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements are available upon request.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VIII, Line 11d Other Miscellaneous Revenue
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Misc. Revenue - Total Revenue: 630, Related or Exempt Function Revenue: , Unrelated Business Revenue: , Revenue Excluded from Tax Under Sections 512, 513, or 514: 630;
